lines.text: [first lines]

[cynical tone]
Eric! Get up! Well, lookie here. Mister Smart Mouth fell asleep with his nose buried in the screen again! Your one-eyed monster is gonna soften your eyes, much less rot your brain! You spend all your time daydreaming and watching those silly movies on the TV and on your projector.

[dressed and speaking as Hopalong Cassidy]
Start dancing!
[fires a shot at Richie's feet]
Say your prayers!
Hey, come on! What did I do? I'm sorry, I...
On your knees! Both knees!

[whimpering]
Please, why are you doing this? I didn't do anything to you.
[Eric suddenly breaks character by laughing insanely]

[normal voice]
How does it feel now, Richie?
Binford?
[alarmed he has been made, Eric shoots Richie several times in the chest, killing him. Eric holsters his gun and casually walks away into the background mist. The image fades to black]
You think the cops suspect me of killing Richie even though I was his best friend?
The cops are paid to suspect everyone but catch no one. That Gallagher is just another flatfoot.
What about that Moriarty character and his tests that he ran with us?
Just a half-wit shrink with a bunch of stupid questions.
They even had Mr. Berger in here last night questioning him about Richie's murder. He's a nervous wreck and he has to go into the hospital next week for his operation.
What operation?
Bypass operation. His heart's worse, man! But he refuses to slow down and continues to smoke and drink. He won't listen to anyone about his heart.
I didn't think he had one.
Never mind that. How are they going to find Richie's killer?

[sly tone]
Bart, if you can't identify him, who can?

[angry tone]
Moriarty, what the hell are you trying to pull behind my back? We questioned all those CFF employees very carefully. Normal police procedure. Now, who the hell gave you the authority to go behind my back and test them?
I cooked up this questionnaire to flush out a suspect.

Flush? That's exactly the right word I'm feeling about your actions! You don't run this police station! I do! For your information, this revolver we found in the back alley where that Richie kid was gunned down is the only real fucking piece of evidence we have!
I don't agree.
Captain Gallagher, Moriarty really has something here.
Of those employees, three of them that took the test stand out as suspects. Eric Binford, Maria Valdez, and Herman...

[rudely cutting him off]
Maria Valdez? That spic broad who works in the shipping department is a killer? That's terrific, thank you Sherlock!
Also, the newspapers think there is a link between the Dracula killing last week and this cowboy killer last night.
One of the victims was a stock boy in an advertising firm and the other was a hooker. Where's the connection?
I don't know yet. It's obviously that we need find this killer to stop...

[rudely interrupting again]
We? What do you mean "we"? You're not a cop! When did you join the police force? I brought you in as a shrink to interview delinquents, not form your own investigation!
I'm just trying to help out.

I don't need your help, or any of your psycho babble tests to help me find a killer! Just in case you didn't notice, you Irish cretin, nobody is asking for your help! So, just knock it off and leave the case to the cops!
Captain, give me a chance. I know I'm onto something. I know the human mind, especially the sick ones.
Fuck the sick minds and fuck yours! Stay out of my way, and stay out of police business!
[Gallagher exits; Moriarty shakes his head with disbelief]

[quiet voice]
What an asshole!
Mornin' Stella.
[Eric lights a cigarette and coughs]
Have you looked at yourself lately? You look like hell!
[Eric takes a puff on his cigarette and blows the smoke into Aunt Stella's face]
Stop making those faces at me! I'll tell you something, if you don't listen to me and start taking care of yourself, you'll never reach age 30.
[Eric continues to ignore Aunt Stella]

When I took you in after your sweet mother died while giving birth to you, I had no idea you'd be such a trial! Your mother was a beautiful woman. She was a great talent. Hollywood was at her feet. Important men were begging to marry her. Then she met your father, that bastard! With that, it was the end of our dance team. You know, I was a fine dancer, the best!

[sarcastic]
Yeah, you're the greatest, Aunt Stella. You tell me that all the time. Magnificent.
It's your fault I'm in this wheelchair! You made me leave that party 20 years ago. Your little troublemaking belly aching! If it wasn't for you, I'd still have my legs!

I still can't believe your still bringing that up after all these years. I didn't ask the babysitter to call you. I was sick that night. I was only four years old. You were drunk and you should not have been driving...
Shut up! You're a loser, Eric! You're worthless just like your father was before he ran out on us!
Yeah, I know!

[angry tone]
Where the hell have you been, Binford? I could have you arrested for stealing company property!
I needed wheels, Mr. Berger.
That's not an answer. Why can't you buy a car with the insurance money that your aunt left you?
That's none of your business.
You shut up! I've been hearing all kinds of things about you lately, Binford.
You mean like my wedding?
Now that is one I haven't heard. I can't picture the creature who'd want to marry you. Tell me, who is this unlucky girl?
She's a famous actress.
And who may this famous actress be?
Marilyn Monroe.
That's it! Hand over the key to the Vespa, Binford.

[mimicking James Cagney]
It's Cody. Got it? Cody Jarrett and don't ever forget it!
Snap out of it, Binford, You name is not Cody. And get your goddamn hands off me! You're fired!

[normal voice]
Too late. I quit!
Where are you going?
Out of my way! I'm going to clean out my work station.
This is my place of business and you're not going inside anymore! I told you that you're fired!
Mr. Berger, if you're firing me, I need to get my stuff out of there and my movie posters. My posters are valuable originals and I want them!

Well you forget them! Anything inside belongs to me! I'll just sell them and keep the money for myself! It might help to pay for some of your screw-ups! Hell, I just might not sell them but burn 'em all to get rid of the memory that you ever worked here!

[mimicking James Cagney again]
Nobody pushes Cody around! You'll be sorry, Big Ed!
You get off my property, you little jerk! Who needs you? This is the best thing that could happen to me!
[Eric angrily walks away where he kicks over the Vespa, turns, gives Mr. Berger the middle-finger bent-elbow jester, and continues to walk away]
Why you son of a bitch! You have some nerve! I'll have your ass for this! Your ass! I'll sue! I'll...
[Mr. Berger suddenly begins painting and grabbing his chest as he begins to have another mild heart attack as he reaches for his heart pills]
